alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 6:34AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Mendenhall Lake Has Crested And Is On Its Way Down... Mendenhall Lake crested during the overnight time frame below bankful, reaching a height of just under 8 ft. The lake has begun dropping again. The latest webcam image from Suicide Basin indicates that the basin is still rising. This tells us that the most likely reason for the rising lake level is due to runoff from heavy rainfall as well as increased upper elevation ice melt. With limited data to work with, the lake level is expected to continue falling through the day on Monday, before a system moving into the panhandle will bring more rain to Juneau. This system will be weaker than the system likely responsible for the recent rise in the lake`s level. Continue to monitor www.weather.gov/juneau for any additional updates.
